column1: wayward! Bounce, pace but slips this down leg. Keeps going away from the keeper, who can't get a hand despite a dive. Five wides to begin
slants this full and across, hint of inward movement from the sixth stump, left alone
down leg again. Looking to attack the stumps, swing takes it down
full and straight on the stumps, defended solidly
slants one across on a length, no swing this time, left alone
punched into the gap, bounces over Maxwell at point. Beats square third man to the boundary. Lovely timing, use of the crease to transfer weight back and play
slanted across, length much fuller, left alone
there's cover, there's point and Markram hops back and punches this into the gap. Poor first over from Starc
slips a length ball into middle and leg, tucked wide of midwicket
works this wide of mid-on, was looking to play it through midwicket but for the bat face which turned in his hand
punched straight to cover point
solidly defended back
squeezes this drive to point, not in control, went with hard hands
crunching cover drive, such a sweet sound that made as it came off the bat. Simply beautiful!
beaten! This one kept a touch low as well as Starc delivered it on a length around off stump
eased into the gap between midwicket and mid-on, too straight from Starc. Nice balance and timing from Quinny
slips this down leg, tucked to fine leg
ducks under this short ball that's bowled a tad outside leg. Lucky to get away, should've been called wide
slants this too far across at 150kph, flirting with that wide line. This call goes against him
yorker-length on off, kept out
nicely controlled as he hops back to get on top of the bounce and defend
tucks this wide of midwicket for an easy single
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
width and he's crashed this wide of point. No chance again for third man, who was a touch too fine. Didn't think he hit it all that well initially
as good as it gets! Shot of the morning. Behrendorff delivers a juicy half-volley and Markram plays a copy book cover drive right out of the top drawer. Can go any distance to watch strokes like that
sways out of the way of this short ball angled across
right behind the line as he defends this length ball on middle and leg
on the pads and he's flicked this to beat fine leg. Starc's having a horror opening spell. Searching for swing again when there's none
nips back in a hint off a length to hit him high on the thigh pad, de Kock was looking to work this through midwicket
pokes at a length ball outside off, beaten on the inside edge as this nips back in. On the bounce to Carey.

blasted through cover! This is superb from QDK. Balance, timing, placement - all in sync. Not much wrong with the delivery - length on off - but de Kock pounced on it in a jiffy and let his timing do the rest
hustles him with a short ball which de Kock plays well by getting on top of the bounce
slower ball on off, nicely played, watched it closely
flatter on middle, punched to mid-on for a quick single
eases back with the turn
misfield off his own bowling means they jog through for a single
steps out and whips this back down the ground off a length. Pure steel and wrist work to beat mid-on, who wasn't far from the ball. Incredible timing.
defended back to the bowler
turns this to midwicket, this was a quicker one

'I've been expecting you, Mr Cummins, says de Kock. Shows the full face of the bat to play an exquisite off drive that nearly took with it the non-striker. Markram had to quickly duck for cover to avoid that crashing into him
right behind the line in defence
punches to mid-on

he's already had me ooooohing and aaaaahing enough. Just keeps getting better! Nothing wrong with the delivery - a length ball angled across, but de Kock shows excellent footwork and hand-eye coordination as he laces this through extra cover. Raced away
short ball angled across, lets it go this time
mid-off dives to get some hand on it. Warner with the full stretch, once again timed so well and was destined to the boundary. Warner saved three.
drifts in from around the stumps, not much turn, worked wide of midwicket

steps out and launches him over long-on without a trace of worry. Pressure? What pressure? It's all off us at the moment, he seems to be saying. This is what playing with a clutter-free mind can do to you. Real pressure on the Aussie bowlers
works this wide of midwicket
chops this cut to point, didn't have the room
eased to mid-on, was on the move as he played it
shortens his length, punched back, good stop.
steered into the gap behind square, excellent stop by Starc at square third man
looks to drive but plays down the wrong line, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
dabs this length ball gently to point
slashed to the point fence! Too much width, no one behind point. Tracer bullet stuff
punched, good stop by a diving Smith at short midwicket
slants this back in from around the stumps, pushed to midwicket
appeal for lbw as this sneaks past the inside edge to hit him on the pad, but the angle would've taken it down.
looking to dab this behind point, nearly ends up chopping on. No room to work with.
driven through the line to extra cover
slower bouncer, he gets on top of the bounce and pats it behind square
dropped off his own bowling! Didn't come back as fast as he expected. Hit him on the left wrist. Was in no position to take that on his followthrough
whips this past the diving midwicket fielder
short and outside off, Cummins hits the bat hard as Markram splices a punch to cover
From 139kph, Cummins drops the pace to 117kph, full and cuts in on off, an inside edge wanders away to the leg side
dug in short and outside off, de Kock hauls a pull in the direction of deep midwicket

Cummins lets rip a bouncer that flies past the head of Markram to a leaping Carey behind the stumps. Top take from the keeper. Markram, too, did well to rock his head out of the way of harm. Wide called for the height
Cummins hits a hard length on off, neither driveable nor pullable, jabbed back to Cummins
dug in short on off, 139kph, Markram hops back and fends it back to the bowler
keeps it short and around off, possibly a slower ball, Markram opens the face and lets the ball slide off the bat to short third man
tossed up, drifts in, de Kock plays back and perhaps manages an inside edge onto the pad. This seemed to be heading down leg, though
tossed up even slower and drifts into middle again, de Kock closes the face a bit and knocks it away just wide of short midwicket for one

Delightful bowling from Lyon. Liberally tossed up outside off, this offbreak grips and drifts away, Lyon has Markram reaching out for a drive, but the batsman loses his balance and is dragged out of the crease. Beaten on the outside edge. Carey does the rest behind the stumps and that's how Lyon provides Australia the breakthrough. Flight: check. Dip: check. Drift: check. No turn but that does not matter
on a length and breaks back in as Faf blocks to cover
flatter and outside off, Faf drives down to long-on
straighter one just a shade outside off, forward and driven to cover
short and angling into off from around the wicket, Faf defensively drops the ball to the off side from the crease
short on off again, this is punched past the right of short cover to mid-off
back of a length and on off, sort of stops on Faf, he drives it weakly to mid-on
short, wide, enough width for Faf to free his arms and scythe it away in the yawning gap at the covers, but it has been cut off near the outfield
pitched further up and outside off to the left-handed de Kock. He drives early and scoops the ball in the air but wide of cover
back of a length and angling into the middle of Faf's back-foot defence to point
looped up on middle, de Kock is forward to smother it back
arm ball from Lyon, de Kock dares to chop from off stump and gets away with an inside edge that rolls past the stumps
another non-turner, but this is shorter and wider of off, allowing de Kock to lean back and chop it away but a misfield gives SA a single
pushed through on off, turns in, prodded to cover from the crease
flighted offbreak, Faf stretches out, gets outside the line and sweeps flat and hard to the leg-side sweeper
tossed outside off, Faf is forward to drive with the break to long-on
full and wide outside off from around the stumps, Faf drills a drive but can't get it past short cover
very full as Starc searches for some inswing. Ends up spraying this one the legs of Faf, ticked away fine on the leg side for four. The man in the deep isn't fine enough
full again and wider than a set of stumps outside off, no shot from Faf
full and wide again, Faf drives a long way away from the body and gets it in the gap. Carved away to the left of sweeper for four
Starc hits a hard length and the splice of du Plessis' bat. Squirted back to the bowler

overpitched and outside off, Faf lays into it, crunching a drive through the covers. Pinged into the boundary off the middle of the bat. Starc has been punished for going too full. Faf brings up SA's hundred in some fashion
darted on off, another non-turner, chopped hard to backward point
de Kock feigns to step out, Lyon pulls his length back on middle, quietly defended back
yet another non-turner on middle, de Kock stretches out for a sweep, and manages to paddle it away fine enough for four
fired just a shade outside off, de Kock jumps back and chops to backward point once again
shorter and outside off, leans back and cracks it to sweeper cover off the back foot
tossed outside off, patted away in front of square off the front foot
drags it down on middle, de Kock has all the time in the word to skip back and pull it away to the left of deep midwicket. Slammed to the square-leg fence, and that's fifty off 43 balls for de Kock
slider on middle, de Kock blocks it
pushed through outside off, tapped to cover
shorter and angling across off, chopped to point
half-tracker outside off, dragged to deep midwicket
worked off the pads to fine leg
dangled up on middle stump, de Kock stays leg-side of the ball and fetches a single down to long-off
nudged with the break behind square on the leg side
slower through the air and drifts in on middle, de Kock blocks to the leg side

Lyon has taken down both the SA openers. Lyon tosses it up outside off, the one that got de Kock did not turn. This offering turns away from de Kock. He dares to force it away against the break. He is nowhere close to the pitch and only skews a catch to Starc at backward point. Both Markram and de Kock have tossed away bright stars
pushed through outside off, stretches out and pushes to the covers
flatter and on off, Rassie drives past the bowler straight of long-on
nip-backer from Cummins, bursts through Rassie's gate and bounces over off stump
short on the hips, nurdled through square leg off the back foot
on a length on off, not good enough to breach Faf's defence
fuller on off, shovelled away to mid-on with the bottom wrist
banged in short on off, Faf backs away a touch, rides the bounce, and carves it away behind point
just short of a good length and outside off, Faf throws his bat at the ball and scythes it away to the left of Lyon at sweeper cover
starts outside off and breaks back in on middle, the length is short, allowing Faf to punch to long-on off the back foot
skids on middle, jabbed away to midwicket
slower and outside off, push-driven to the covers
full on the stumps, defended
Lyon lobs an offbreak outside off, Rassie stretches forward in defence
slider just a shade outside off, angled out to point
short of length on middle and leg, whipped to long leg
gets a thick inside edge on an attempted drive to short midwicket
slips this full delivery into the pads, eased straight to midwicket
reverse? Veers back in a long way, almost yorker-length, squeezed to mid-on
hit on the back of the helmet! Beaten for pace as he attempts to pull in front of square. The physio comes out for a mandatory check. Rassie seems to be fine though.
hustled for pace, smashes the thigh pad and rolls to the leg side
lunges forward and stabs this away into the off side
through the gate! Beats the batsman and keeper. Rassie was looking to defend as he lunged forward
works this with the spin to long-on
fired in from wide of the crease, defended back
in the air but safe, chipped wide of midwicket
drilled through the cover region, fielder dives to the right but can't stop. Finch the man inside the ring. Too much flight this time from Lyon
right behind the line as he defends this incoming length delivery
works this uppishly but wide of the diving short midwicket fielder
defends with his bat close to the body
yorker-length, squeezes the flick to wide mid-on for a quick single
driven on the bounce to mid-off
sways out of the line of this short ball
turns this wide of short fine leg
stumping missed! Rassie looked to skip out and clear long-on, but didn't account for the turn. This one went straight through to beat his swing and Carey
steps out and stabs this flatter delivery.
chipped over the bowler's head to long-on
turns this wide of midwicket, looks for a single but is sent back
punches to long-on as they jog the single
slants this length ball into middle and leg, he works this nicely using his wrists towards the man coming in from deep square. Aggressive, purposeful running
works this wide of midwidwicket
stands tall and punches this length ball into the gap at sweeper cover
full, veering into middle and leg, works this wide of mid-on
wrists this length ball on middle and leg to midwicket
slower bouncer, Rassie ducks under this one
sways out of the way of this short ball angled in
looks to turn this into the leg side but the ball drifts away, the leading edge rolls to cover
shortens his length , Faf nudges this into the gap between midwicket and square leg. The boundary rider had to come in a long way, superb running
tucks this straight to short fine leg
punches down to long-on
gentle dab into the off side as they scamper a single
turns this with the spin to short midwicket

punches to mid-off and chances a risky run, had there been a clean pick-up and direct hit at the bowler's end, Rassie may have been struggling. Turns out the fielder didn't collect the ball to throw it in the first place
whipped to deep square, too short
pulled, not in control, on the bounce to Behrendorff at deep square
slower short of length delivery on off, punched to long-off
slips in a full toss, a gift of a delivery, and Rassie sends it where it should be. Thumped through extra cover
on the pads once again, turned to deep square
works this down to long-on
works this down towards deep square, superb running again
makes room and punches this to extra cover
drilled into the acres of open space at sweeper cover, Behrendorff does wonderfully well to run around and throw in a dive to stop it and save a couple of runs
shuffles across, but the ball drifts away, defended back
defended gently towards midwicket
driven handsomely to sweeper cover
length outside off, bunted to point
steps out to make room, Starc follows him, defended bak
short ball, angling in, rising and Faf does well to get on top of the bounce to defend
thumps this but straight to mid-off
too much width outside off and he slaps this into the gap towards the long boundary at extra cover. Teaser for the fielder, was never going to stop it
dabs it gently into the off side
turns this wide of short midwicket
skids one back into the batsman, punched back. Maxwell and Faf collide at the non-striker's end as he dives across to save a single
delicate little glide to short third man, was looking to ease that into the gap
bunts to short midwicket, tight bowling this
works this past midwicket
short and aimed at the hips, tucked to deep midwicket off the back foot
banged in short and outside off, Faf hops back and fends it off to short midwicket
short and attached with a lot of width outside off, cracked to sweeper cover. Faf reaches a fifty off 54 balls
chest-high short ball on leg stump, Rassie don't get hold of the pull, the top-edge does not carry to long leg
back of a length and angling away outside off, Faf stands tall and punches to mid-off hanging back
short at the body, flapped away behind square on the leg side
reverse-swept from the stumps to backward point
pushed through on middle and leg, Rassie ventures forward and drives the ball down to long-on
flatter and faster on leg stump, too full for the sweep as the ball wanders away to square leg
shorter and slides on outside off, Faf goes deep in the crease and smears the ball to sweeper cover
short on the stumps, punched down to long-on
nudged with the break to square leg
back of a length and angling into middle, jabbed away to midwicket
slower offcutter from Cummins, grips and bounces, beats the inside edge, grazes the back pad and rolls down to third man
short and hits the bat hard, Faf backs away, gives himself swinging room and forces the ball only as far as mid-off
dug in short on off, Faf rocks back and nails a pull to the left of deep midwicket. Behrendoff throws himself to his left in the outfield and intercepts the ball. Top work from Behrendoff
here comes Faf.... Down the track, takes oit on a half-volley and launches it straight over Cummins' head. Pumped into the sightscreen
slower ball, short and wide outside off, Faf picks it up and crunnnnnnnnnches it through the covers. Looks like Faf has kicked into a higher gear. Over to you Rassie
straighter one outside off, tipped into the cover-point region off the front foot
Faf uses his feet and works this shorter offbreak to short midwicket
swept again, flat and hard to deep midwicket
shorter and turns in on off, cramps Rassie for room, jammed to mid-on
Maxwell shortens his length after seeing Rassie use his feet, knocked to square leg
down the track and whipped away firmly between deep midwicket and deep square leg. Aggressive running from Faf and Rassie - they hare back for the second adding to Maxwell's frustration
skids on outside off, lashed away to the left of extra-cover for a double
pushed through outside off, Rassie reverse-swats it away to the sweeper. Either side of that fielder would have been four
looped up outside off, not much turn, Faf stretches out and slog-sweeps it in the air over midwicket. Timed the pants off it
shorter and spins in, Faf was expecting it, hangs back and works it away to leg
shorter and outside off, Faf slots it away to wide long-on off the back foot
tossed just a shade outside off, defended off the front foot
pushed through on middle and leg, knocked through square leg. The fifth bowler quota is done for Australia, but with so much turn on offer Finch gives Maxwell another go
tossed outside off, Rassie now twinkles down the track and does a du Plessis. He meets the pitch and pumps it high and over Maxwell's head. Shot, Rassie!
darted on the hips, worked around the corner to follow up the six with a single
on a length and breaks in, nudged away through square leg for one
round-arm skidder, Rassie jabs it to short midwicket
another round-arm dart, slashed to the covers
back of a length and on off, Faf sits back and clips it away to the right of mid-on
keeps it on a back of a length and attacks the stumps, Rassie clips but finds midwicket
back of a length and around off, possibly a slower ball, tip and run to point. Excellent running from Faf and Rassie once again
off-stump yorker, dug out to the covers
just short of a good length and outside off, Faf flat-bats it away straight of mid-on for four. Not middled, but enough to trickle away to the fence
pitched up and outside off, right in Faf's swinging arc. He middles it to the long-on boundary. Lifted over mid-on
slides on just a shade outside off, Rassie forces it down to long-on
speared on off, Faf whips to long-on with the bottom wrist
pushed through on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
down the track and clipped to short midwicket, where the fielder dives to his right to stop the ball
on the hips, tucked to deep backward square
back of a length and fizzes in on middle, short-armed away in the air... but does not carry to midwicket
slower cutter on middle, nudged to deep midwicket
another slower ball, which is smeared past the bowler's outstretched left hand to long-off
a whirl of the wrists sends this full ball on middle to deep midwicket
pitched up on off, Rassie takes a step or two forward and belts it away over the square leg boundary. Picked up with the angle and smoked over the square boundary
tucked around the corner, all along the ground now to follow that six with a single
on a length and cuts away outside off, sliced to backward point. The slower one nearly trickled Faf
banged in short and cramps Rassie for room, he top-edges a pull over square leg
more short stuff, Faf controls his pull and gets it away to fine leg
short on off, Cummins finds some extra bounce, dinked to short third man
short and outside off, Faf stays leg-side of the ball and punches it through the covers, where Warner dives to his left to intercept the ball
rapid bouncer, flies past the throat of Rassie, who shelves the hook
Cummins closes out the over with another well-directed bouncer, Rassie attempts a hook but can't lay bat on ball
slower and fuller outside off, drilled into the gap at wide long-off
nice and full outside off, driven to long-off again

there's a direct under-arm flick by Smith at the non-striker's end from cover. Rassie seems to be in trouble, even the dive seems to be futile. Oh well, how wrong was I. Replays confirm he has just been saved by the dive in fact. I purely went by his body language, which read OUT. But well, I was so wrong. That also brings up his seventh ODI fifty
plays the short-arm jab to deep midwicket
walks across the stumps and flat-bats this short ball straight to long-on
mistimes this slower ball back to the bowler, was looking to pick the gap at cover
gets outside the line to play a premeditated slog sweep, deflects off the pad to short third man
can't beat midwicket, a diving stop by Smith to save a certain single
fired in from wide of the crease, tucks straight to short fine
steps out and works this down to the man coming in from long-on, wanted the second but Starc's quick to fire the throw
reverse paddled very neatly, played it very early, the bowler knew what Rassie was doing and yet couldn't do much about it. No chance for short third man
fired full on the stumps, kept out
works this into the gap at midwicket, the man coming in from the deep was caught napping. Superb running

driven to long-off, off comes the helmet, belts out a roar, thumps his chest and holds his arms aloft to soak in the applause. 12th ODI century for Faf! The South African balcony stands to acknowledge a fine, fine knock
flicked up and over, one bounce to the fine leg boundary. Length ball angling in and he just walked across the stumps to pick this up. Easily done
beaten by the dipping slower delivery, walked across to sweep, then flick as he changed his mind, got into a tangle in the end
wallops this slower full toss outside off to deep midwicket

slices a slog to short third man. End of a fab, fab knock. It's amazing how batsmen play clean shots and get the big hits even if they don't wish to. The moment they start slogging, they end up miscuing and edging. Looked to pull, played too early, didn't pick the slower ball and was through with the shot nearly as it lobbed off the toe end. Fine knock and rightly applauded off the field.
works this down to the man coming in from long-on to get off the mark
punches to deep midwicket
driven straight to cover
steps out and works this down to long-on
fired across from round the stumps, works this down to long-on
fired down leg, Duminy looks to play the fine paddle but misses, keeper half-stops
walks into the stroke as he works this to midwicket
reverses back in off a length on off, rolls off a thick inside edge to midwicket
right into the blockhole, squeezed to long-on
looks to carve this yorker behind point, toe-ends a slog instead to cover. Late reverse, angled wide as well. Good bowling
dug out to long-on, another inswinging yorker
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to cover
looks to pull, get a thick inside edge down to fine leg
carved into the gap at extra cover! This was full, fired wide as JP made room, he reached out to hit this and hit it very well
pulled to deep midwicket, was looking to hit it to the short boundary
in the slot and out of the park! Clears long-on with ease. Right into his hitting arc and Rassie didn't try to slog, hit it right off the middle
Jadhav-esque low-arm slingy, flicked to deep midwicket
hit really well but back to the bowler
flicks this to short fine leg
full ball on the stumps, makes room and digs this out to long-off
full toss veering into the pads, flicked straight to deep square
mistimes this pull to midwicket
swung across the line, into the gap at wide long-on.

pulled to long-on! JP backs away to get the free swing but is done in by the pace. Gets this off the top part of the bat so there was no timing whatsoever, excellent catch moving forward. End of an ODI career that could've been so much more, perhaps.
pulled into the gap at deep backward square leg, back for the second
skiddy length ball angling in, slips past the thigh pad and it's a wide
flayed on the up but straight to point

direct hit from Smith at the bowler's end from short cover and Rassie was gone. Instead, they'll get an overthrow and Rassie is back on strike. Smith took his time to fire the throw, just couldn't hit
pulled, how far back? Very far. Fetched it from outside off, hit it very, very well.
slips this too far wide again
fetches the pull from outside off, and he's picked the bones out of this. No chance for the man at deep square. Emphatic hit
hops back and nudges this to the man coming in from deep square, super running
pulled to deep midwicket
drilled to sweeper cover
reverses away, punched to long-off
dabs this down to third man
wide yorker, reaches out to squeeze behind point but misses. Wide called and rightly so
thick edge, excellent reflexes from Carry to throw himself to his right to stop this on the bounce

full, straight, late reverse and boom! The stumps go for a walk as this is a pitch-perfect yorker. Pretorious was looking for the wild swing, by the time his bat came down, the ball had crashed into the stumps
another ripper of an inswinging yorker, Andile just about manages to get his bat down in time. Not sure how, but he did.
pulled imperiously but straight to deep square
carved away to the point boundary. Thought he'd improvise so bowled full and wide, Andile was ready to reach out and pick the gap behind square. Lovely timing, excellent awareness of the field
full and wide again, looks to squeeze behind point but misses and they scoot a bye
full and angled into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
top-edges the pull and it falls in no man's land. Could've taken the single but he doesn't. Deiva belts out 'Rassie, channel the spirit of MS'

flat-bats the pull, which for most parts looked to be a six, until you saw Maxwell throw himself high in the air at deep midwicket to pluck this with the sun right in front of his eyes. Rassie also picked out the longest boundary. 95 but what a knock, he'll have many more opportunities in the future to get a century,
mighty full on middle, not turn either way, jabbed back to Tahir
pushed through on middle and leg, Warner knocks the ball to short midwicket

tossed up slower and higher, turns in on middle, inside-edged towards square leg's left. There's a massive mix-up between the wickets and SA can't capitalise on it. Both batsmen are near the middle of the pitch. The throw from Rabada is to the wrong end - non-striker's - Warner had strayed so far out of the crease. Rabada should've tried to knock him over. In the end, both are safe
fuller and outside off, driven to mid-off's left
wrong'un? Finch drops the ball to the leg side and hustles to the other end
fuller and outside off, tapped to point
short and wide outside off, carved in the air, but fine of Shamsi at deep third man
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Warner feels for the ball and is beaten, as is de Kock behind the stumps as the ball wobbles out
good length on off, tap and run to mid-off
shortish on middle and leg, Finch hops and glances behind square for a single
short and moves back in against the angle, zips through Warner's defences and bounces over middle stump
banged in short on leg stump, 142ks, Warner leaps and awkwardly fends to the leg side

Run, run,run, Tahir! Don't catch him, people. Just let him run to.... Look at that celebration. Tahir himself said he'll miss it. Flatter legbreak, spins away outside off, Finch is on the back foot, punching in the air to short cover
fuller and spins in on leg stump, worked to the leg side for one
clipped to deep midwicket
tucked away with the break to deep midwicket
full-toss outside off, Khawaja stretches out and punishes Tahir with a drive to the right of mid-off
pitched up and wide outside off, Warner reaches out for the ball and pings it over the infield. Hoisted over extra-cover
back of a length on middle, Warner defends to cover and cries 'No!no!' to Khawaja
cracker from Rabada! Back of a length and swerves away outside off, Warner did well not to jab at it and instead tuck his bat inside the line
bouncer, angling away outside off, nasty prancing delivery, Warner does well to sway his upper body out of the way
kicks up from a back of a length on middle, Warner diffuses it to point
good length and seams back in, tickled away through square leg
floated up on middle, nudged away, the fielder at short midwicket dives over the ball
reverse-swept from outside off to backward point
low full-toss on leg stump, Khawaja goes low with it and sweeps it flat and hard to deep square leg. He is struggling to run between the wickets

worked to the leg side. There's a single here but Khawaja is struggling to run between the wickets, having received treatment on his calf/leg in the previous over. Looks like Khawaja is going off and Smith is coming in. Another man down for Australia
fired on leg stump, Warner misses the sweep and wears it on the pad
short and just a shade outside off, shuffles into the line and blocks back to the bowler
shortish and outside off, shuffles across and defends to midwicket does Smith

clipped through square leg after going deep in the crease. Australia chance a third, Tahir throws to the keeper who relays to Rabada but the bowler can't collect the ball and disturb the stumps. Another run-out chance missed by Rabada. Smith now gets a life. Australia's batsmen are trying to run themselves out
Warner goes boom! Just short of a good length and angling across off, Warner sizes it up and smites it over midwicket
back of a length and angling across off, defended
stabbed back to the bowler
shortish and outside off, blocked to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, 126ks, Smith moves back and pummels a pull to the midwicket boundary

Pretorius wins an lbw appeal and celebrates the wicket of Smith. Smith has a word with Warner and decides against a review. On a good length and straight, Smith jumps across off in his own inimitable way and aims to work the ball away through the leg side but plays all around it and is pinned on the knee-roll of the front pad. Was height an issue? I'm not sure, the tracker might have returned umpire's call. Yup, umpire's call it is with the ball trimming the bails
good length on off, played back to the bowler
shortish and outside off, punched to the covers
full and wobbles away outside off, beats the outside edge.
shortish and angling across off, fended to point
back of a length and slanting away just outside off, Warner stays leg-side of the ball and forces it to cover
middle-stump yorker, dug out
banged in short on off, Warner top-edges a hook and squirts it away to the fine-leg boundary. Why's fine leg inside the circle?
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away through midwicket
back of a length and angling into off at 144ks, defended off the back foot
back of a length and slanting into the hips from around the wicket, deflected only as far as square leg
short on top of off, Stoinis stands up tall and punches up to short cover
full inswinger, inside-edged onto the pad and the lbw appeal is turned down
good length and curves in on off, Stoinis has a very short stride and manages to block it away to the leg side
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
good length and nips away outside off, left alone
short on middle, 141ks, Warner hops and tucks it to deep square leg
short and outside off, punched hard into the ground, excellent stop by Faf at point
short and on off, stands tall and punched back to the bowler
stands tall and punches to cover once again. Stoinis 0 off 12
Stoinis keeps middling these back-foot punches but can't get it past extra-cover and get off the mark. Make that 0 off 13
crunnnnnnched! Back of a length and outside off, Stoinis middles another punch, this time he finds the gap at cover
whips this short ball to deep midwicket
short ball on off, pulled to deep square where Shamsi comes up with a sliding stop
gets half-forward and defends this gently into the off side
nice and full on the stumps, kept out
eases this full delivery on the stumps to mid-on
gets a good stride forward and defends with his  bat close to the pad
width and that has been disdainfully slapped to the deep cover boundary. Buffet ball, shocker of a first ball
pokes and misses. Superb comeback, drew him forward and got this to seam away
gets half-forward and bunts it into the off side
tight line, in and around the off stump again, defended firmly from the crease
hops back and tucks this short of length delivery into the leg side
right on top of the bounce as he defends back
skiddy short ball way over the batsman's head, wide called. He swayed out of the way nicely though
goes full, just around off, defended from the crease
squirts one off a thickish inside edge to mid-on
gorgeous! Just a hint of width and he punches into the gap between cover and point
on a length, angles into middle and leg, squirts it off an inside edge to square leg
thick edge as he looks to glide this behind point, races to the third man boundary
works this off his hip to deep backward square leg
back of length outside off, punched to extra cover
squared up by the length but he manages to defend solidly
hops back and works this wide of square leg
works this incoming length ball to midwicket
right behind the line as he defends this short of length delivery
punched back to mid-off
touch fuller from around the stumps at 130kph, stabbed to cover
chipped over the bowler's head, races down the ground. Something about the stroke said Warner checked his stroke because this one held on the surface, but boy, his bat is incredible
squirts one down to third man off a thick outside edge
stood tall and punched this imperiously through midwicket. Top shot
nice and full outside off, this one moves away a hint in the air, defended
cramped for room, defended back
bounce, pace, skid and angle. Troubles Warner who is beaten as he tries to arch back and help it over the slip cordon
punches to point, JP's the man there
he's clobbered this deep into the stands at midwicket. Helped that he was hitting this to the short boundary. Picked the length and got into position very early.
scythes this through point, down to third man
tucks this gently into the gap at midwicket
arches back and helps this along to third man again
defends back
cuts to deep point
googly which he eases to long-off
fired full on the pads, tucked to midwicket
nicely tossed up, draws him forward and Warner pushes it to cover
works this down to long-on
back of length delivery angling away, defended with soft hands
lovely drive, straight to mid-off though but they'll take a quick single. Warner's 21st ODI fifty. Will need him to cover this into a big one if they are to get close
stands tall and punches to deep cover
slants a length ball across, Warner deflects this very late to square third man
short ball angling down and he helps this along to the fine leg boundary. Easily done, poor ball from Morris
right behind the line as he bunts it to point
too short, he rocks back and hammers the pull to the vacant midwicket boundary
tucks this to midwicket

gentle nudge to square leg, in comes Rabada with a quick throw even as QDK removes the bails. They're going up to check if Stoinis made the crease. Tell you what, that is absolutely brilliant! De Kock with an MS Dhoni like back-handed flick done in the most casual way possible, which probably made the batsman take it easy too. Massive moment in the game. Sensational from Quinton!
driven to short cover, super stop by Andile, threw himself to his right
flipper which Maxwell punches to point
draws him forward with the drift, gets it to spin away. Maxwell gets well forward and defends
cuts but straight to point
eased with the spin to point again
dropped by Quinton? Warner went for a big booming drive, beaten by sharp turn and dip. Couldn't latch on. Have to see a replay to confirm if there was an edge. Looks like there wasn't any.
bunted into the off side
punched into the gap at cover
driven into the gap to deep cover again
short and outside off, Maxwell jumps back and pulls hard to midwicket on the bounce
Maxwell nails the pull and the gap this time. Dug in short and outside off, sits up to be smacked. Maxwell happily obliges and hits it between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Maxwell drives away from the body on the back foot and winds up slicing an outside edge down to deep third man
short and sits up again, this time to Warner. These are lollipops from Andile. Warner goes back and muscles it over midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Warner stays leg-side of the ball as he punches with an open face to sweeper cover
good length and around off stump, Maxwell opens the face and plays to cover
starts on middle and breaks away, Warner steps back and punches the ball straight to point
shorter and spins away, punched much straighter to cover with the break. Warner searches for a quick single, but Rassie swoops down on the ball and forces Warner to undo his steps
slower through the air on middle, not much turn either way, eased to long-off off the front foot
full and turns back in, worked towards midwicket with the spin
shorter and outside off, laced to long-off off the back foot
fuller and spins away outside off, Warner searches for a cut even as the ball isn't short enough. The resultant outside edge flies through vacant slip
back of a length and snakes back in, Maxwell has a crack at it and under-edges it behind to the keeper
shorter and outside off, Maxwell swings for the hills...and misses the line
shorter and nips away outside off against the angle, catches Maxwell in a tangle. The resultant outside edge runs down to third man
shorter and outside off, check-driven to short cover
shorter and outside off, Maxwell pings it to short cover
punched on the up again, but that man Rassie throws himself to his left to intercept the ball
fuller and spins back into middle and leg, Maxwell whips it away through the leg side
tossed on off, Warner ventures down the track and drives down to long-off
wrong'un, shorter and outside off, Maxwell picks it off the pitch and punches to cover
clipped off the pads to deep midwicket for one
Shamsi belts out an appeal for lbw, but umpire Dar does not budge. Full slider from Shamsi, Warner plays down the wrong line and misses it. It might not have threatened leg stump
fuller and attacking the stumps, defended

Wow, one-hander from de Kock! Rapid lifter outside off, rushes Maxwell into a hook. He top-edges it. The ball seems destined to fly over the head over the keeper... until de Kock leaps and plucks it out of thin air with his weak hand - right.
welcomes Carey with a gem! Hits an in-between length and gets it to curve away past the outside edge
fuller and outside off, pushed to short cover's left
on a length and outside off, driven on the up and through the covers. Caressed away to the left of sweeper
fended off to the leg side for one
back of a length and on middle, punched from the stumps to sweeper cover
fired on leg stump, down the track and forced down to long-off
slower through the air on middle, played back to the bowler
drifts in on off, slower, inside-edged to the midwicket region
tossed outside off, driven to short cover's left
pushed through outside off, driven to short cover once again
straighter one, defended back to Duminy
shorter and spins away outside off, Warner goes on the back foot and slaps it to cover
looped up on off, forward and smothered by Carey
skids on outside off, chopped weakly to short cover
back of a length on off, punched past Shamsi
flighted on middle, forward and patted to the right of short cover
shorter and spins away outside off, Carey rides the bounce and smartly glides the ball behind point
full and on leg stump, Warner backs away and drives firmly to long-on
full-toss and outside off, eased down to long-off
shorter and follows Warner who is backing away outside leg, forced to the covers
fired on off, jabbed down to long-on
shorter and outside off, cracked off the back foot to sweeper cover
near-yorker length on leg stump, dug back to the bowler
dragged outside off, spins away further, Warner cuts straight to backward point
on a length and breaks away outside off, tapped gently enough towards point for a single
tossed on middle, Carey is early into a drive and chips it back, does not carry to Shamsi
shorter and outside off, Carey leans back and cuts to sweeper cover
floated up on off, Warner comes down the track, gets too close, and slices it just over Rassie at cover
fuller and outside off, driven through the line, Rassie in the thick of the action again, diving to his left to stop the ball
Whoa! Warner brings out the switch-hit. He falls on the floor but manages to swat it over backward point
slider, takes the inside edge and rolls away to the leg side
might full on middle, pushed to short cover
down the track and drilled down to long-off
slides in with the arm, flatter and faster, Warner misjudges the length and chops an inside edge onto the pad
Duminy draws the inside edge again, this rolls away to the man at 45 on the leg side
steps out, the bowler fires it in and Warner blocks
breaks away sharply off a length, pushed into the covers
whipped over midwicket, clean strike! Welcome boundary. Australia ticking along even as the asking rate mounts
cut away to sweeper point
top-edges the sweep and it swirls over short fine leg. Lucky runs for Warner
rocks back and cuts straight to point
slapped back to the bowler
drifting into the pads, worked to short fine, looks like it came off a bit of an inside edge
lovely back cut, played it very very late. Beat backward point to the fence. Very nice
driven firmly but straight to cover, hint of a mix-up but no damage done in the end. Warner lucky
hit hard, absolutely drilled. Races to the extra cover fence. Long-off was not far from the ball but stood no chance
bunts it gently with the turn to Rabada at point, they scamper a single
works this tossed up delivery to long-on
goes inside-out over cover and boy, that's as sublime as it gets. Marches into the 90s with a quality stroke against the turn. Make no mistake - there's life in this contest yet
eased to point as they scamper a run
dropped off his own bowling! Almost as if Tahir didn't expect that to come back to him
works this towards midwicket
chopped to long-on, this was a half-tracker and Tahir is lucky to get away with that
defends back as Morris bowls a full ball from around the stumps
gentle tap into the off side as they scamper a quick single
uses the depth of the crease to whip this fine, long chase for fine leg but couldn't get there. Shamsi was also a little late to move to his left. The boundaries keep coming. Warner ain't giving up.

edged and four! There comes the leap, the Australian dressing room stands. This is No. 17 for Warner, who has a big smile on his face. Not where he wanted this to go but runs nonetheless. Touch fuller, Warner made room to ease behind point but the extra bounce meant this flew off the edge. Stunning knock that keeps Australia's flame burning
slower length ball on middle, stabbed away
both feet in the air as he hops to defend
lofted over mid-off, not timed well but it kept gathering speed after it bounced. Skidded off the surface
steps out and works this past the diving Tahir, who gets a bit of hand on it
tossed up, he lunges forward and defends back. Hits the stumps at the bowler's end but Tahir didn't get a hand on it
turns this with the spin back towards the bowler
swept fiercely but straight to deep square leg
steps out but he has to lunge out even more as Tahir gets this to dip on him, hit on the pad
slower and fuller, Warner waits inside the crease as he clubs this back over the bowler's head. Disdainful
whips this to deep square leg
squeezes out this yorker to the off side
hit on the box as this angles back in from round the stumps, was looking to whip it square
top-edges a pull that lands short of fine leg
pulled but not entirely well timed, but he's hitting it towards the short boundary. Good work by Andile running around to stop from deep square leg
mid-on inside the ring and he muscles it past him. Drag down from Shamsi, can't afford that
steered to deep point

swept over short fine, races away. Premeditated but hit it exactly where he wanted this to go. Faf has a worried look on his face now, some nerves perhaps? This is quickly getting away from South Africa. Need a wicket, now.
steps out and lofts inside-out over cover, precise placement. Didn't try to hit it hard, pure timing. The Australia flags are waving briskly now. There's hope.
rocks back and slaps this to deep cover
paddled away nicely to fine leg, they amble back for the second.
works this wide of midwicket for an easy single
slower length ball angling in, tucked to fine leg
bunts to midwicket, quick single stolen
slower length ball, Carey taps into the off side, refuses the single after initially looking for it
sublime drive to deep cover
flicks this full toss to deep midwicket
works this off his hip into the leg side

direct hit at the striker's end would've made it interesting, Warner was sprinting with all his might. Just a gentle tap behind square on the off side by Carey. Warner was also ducking for cover from the throw
pulled from outside off to deep square
arches back and helps this along wide of the keeper to bring up his half-century! What a knock, what temperament. Carey is quietly leaving his imprint in this Australian set up. Super knock
dug in short, zips past his ears as he avoids that
raw pace, pure pace, short ball that he's hustled with, defended

that's a stunner! Long-on was brought in specifically for this over, Morris, Superman Morris, plucks a magical catch running sideways at mid-on. Warner looks to belt this length ball over mid-on, hits it very well but Morris is just a tad too tall as he moves well to his left and times his jump to perfection to pluck that. Trust me that was travelling. What a knock from Warner though!
excellent short ball, he gets out of the way as it zips through to de Kock
dabs this to point, can't get a run
looks to arch back and upper cut, not much bounce for that. Beaten
superb diving stop at midwicket by Morris. This was floated full from wide of the crease, flicked well but stopped well too
squirts another one off an inside edge to midwicket. Wicket maiden!
looped up outside off, looks like a wrong'un, sliced away over the infield. The ball trickles towards wide long-on
fuller and flatter on the stumps, bunted back to Tahir
dragged down on middle, pulled away, but there's protection at deep midwicket for Tahir
shorter and on top of off stump, Cummins stands up tall and punches the ball down to long-on, ticking over the strike to Carey
Shot, Carey! He surges down the track, takes a half-volley from outside off and belts it past the right of Tahir. Try stopping that
shorter and outside off, down the track again, smeared away to the left of mid-on. Carey searches for the second. Not this time, mate
shorter and spins away outside off, lashed straight to extra-cover off the back foot
steered away with the break to short third man off the back foot
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Cummins forces the ball to short midwicket off the back foot
tipped to short cover off the front foot, but no single there, Cummins
speared outside off, Cummins drills to wide long-on and they take the single on offer
slides on outside off, past the tramline, though, no shot
flighted on middle, Carey gives himself some room.Dashes down the track and punches to long-off to keep strike
flatter and faster outside off, Carey cracks it down to long-off and gets only a single
dangled up outside off, Cummins lofts it with the spin over extra-cover. Delicious timing
dragged down on middle, Cummins rocks back and nails a pull to deep midwicket
Smoked over wide long-on! Looped up and outside off, Carey stretches out and slog-sweeps it with the spin over the leg-side boundary
flighted outside off, Carey clears his front leg and pumps it straight of long-on. Power plus precision. This is some innings from Carey - and it brings the asking rate to under ten
shorter and wider outside off, chopped away in the gap between backward point and short third man
darted outside off, short, Carey throws his bat at the ball and slashes it away fine of short third man
pushed through on the leg stump, too full, Carey gets underneath the length and muscles a slog-sweep to the midwicket boundary. Bam!
shorter and outside off, carved off the back foot to backward point
speared on middle, short, Carey goes on the back foot and scythes it away to the left of sweeper. Carey hares back for the second. Another Australia-South Africa thriller brewing 20 years on
slog-swept from outside off to deep midwicket. Pinged off the middle of the bat but straight to the boundary rider
darted short on the leg stump, slugged to deep square leg and Carey takes the single on offer
slower short ball outside off, 106ks, scythed away to the left of short cover
full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off - Cummins reaches out for the ball and slices a single to deep third man and gets Carey back on strike
back of a length and Andile floats a slower ball down the leg side. He was perhaps put off by Carey flitting around the crease
slower short ball, cramps Carey for room. He flaps a pull down to wide long-on

106ks slower ball outside off from Andile. Cummins can't manufacture enough pace for himself. He has a hack at this but only skies it straight down the gullet of long-off. Duminy settles under it in fuss-free fashion
short on leg stump, cramps the batsman for room once again, Carey pulls but can't get it past the tumbling Tahir
Andile hits a hard length around off, Starc drives it to sweeper cover and secures a single. Excellent over from Andile - just five off it plus the wicket of Cummins
off-stump yorker, Morris gives Starc a taste of his own medicine, jammed to point

...and Carey has picked out the off-side sweeper. Makram dives and swoops down on the ball. That should be the game. Carey backs away, gives himself some swinging room, opens the face and slices it to the outfielder. He elicits a standing ovation from Finch, Ponting, Smith, Shaun Marsh. Gem of an innings from Carey
fuller and angling into leg stump from round the stumps, not a yorker, squeezed to midwicket
short and slanting into the hips of Starc, he swings at it and sends the ball only as far as long leg
back of a length on leg stump, Starc smears it to mid-on
bouncer outside off, whizzes past the hook. Just eight runs plus two wickets off the last two overs
short and outside off, Khawaja swings hard, loses his shape, and does not make contact with the ball
shorter and outside off, spliced to mid-off on the bounce. Khawaja can't manufacture enough power
short and on middle, Khawaja stays leg-side of the ball and dabs it to the left of the keeper
full-toss on off, jabbed away to deep midwicket
banged in short, Khawaja backs away, tests out his hamstring, goes deeper in the crease, and swivels into a hook. He gets it away fine of long leg
full-toss on leg stump, backs away and drills it to sweeper cover
Khawaja shuffles around the crease, aims to scoop it over the keeper, ends up cue-ending it down to third man
on a length and on middle, Starc sat back waiting for this length. Smites it over midwicket for a six
overpitched on middle, Morris gets the yorker wrong, Starc gets his swing right. He clears his front leg and belts it straight past the bowler
very full and wide, reaches out for the ball and drives to sweeper with a slicing motion

Khawaja jumps across off, Morris follows him, but he still can't get the yorker right. This full-toss is whipped with the wrists to the left of deep midwicket. Injured hamstring and all, Khawaja puts it away
Morris finally hits the blockhoke, yorker just outside off, squirted through the cover-point region. 17 off that over

Khawaja jumps too far across off, exposes all three stumps and searches for a scoop over the keeper's head. Rabada spears a full-toss, and Khawaja can just deflect it back onto the top of the stumps. Khawaja hobbles off for 18. Finch applauds from the change room
bouncer on middle, fended to the leg side off a leading edge
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and slices it to third man's right
short and outside off, jabs a pull down to long-on

full and straight, Rabada makes a mess of the stumps and follows it up with a stare. The middle stump is tilted back. Starc aims to swing down the ground, but misses the line although the length was in the slot
back of a length and outside off, punched to sweeper cover. Rabada finishes with 3 for 56

slower ball on the hips. Slugged away over short fine leg. Duminy tears to his right and slides to haul the ball in. Can he walk into the sunset with a win? Good work from Duminy in the dying moments of his career
short and wide outside off, Lyon slices underneath it and gets the ball to sweeper cover
slower and fuller outside off, carved down to long-off. Behrendoff hares back for the second, QdK breaks the stumps, but isn't quite quick enough
slower ball on a back of a length, spliced down to long-off. Lungi flashes a big smile in the change room
Andile closes it out for South Africa. Another slower roller, Lyon picks it up and hoicks it into the lap of deep midwicket
